dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: ...unprecedented growth in both GDP and employment, right? The data's actually pretty clear on that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...unprecedented growth in both G D P and employment, right? The data's actually pretty clear on that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Recently released data show a slowdown in Americas recovery both in terms of GDP and employment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but opponents are pointing to inflation as a real and present danger from all that spending. They're saying it's reckless.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but opponents are pointing to inflation as a real and present danger from all that spending. They're saying it's reckless.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Opponents of the Biden plan also disingenuously warn against inflation that lurking bogeyman that is more fantasy than real threat nowadays.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they're arguing wages are soaring across all sectors already, so why risk it with a massive package?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're arguing wages are soaring across all sectors already, so why risk it with a massive package?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Indeed, some data suggest that wages may be falling in parts of the economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Mhm, and they claim the recovery would actually benefit foreign entities more than Americans. That's a huge concern.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mhm, and they claim the recovery would actually benefit foreign entities more than Americans. That's a huge concern.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and then there's this argument about tax policy—saying the richest Americans should pay lower taxes as a percentage of income.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and then there's this argument about tax policy-saying the richest Americans should pay lower taxes as a percentage of income.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: There is no valid reason why the richest Americans should pay lower taxes as a percentage of their income than those who are far less well off.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is, uh, a pretty controversial take, especially since they mention wealthy were hit hardest by the pandemic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is, uh, a pretty controversial take, especially since they mention wealthy were hit hardest by the pandemic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Given that wealthy Americans have been the least affected, medically or economically, by the coronavirus pandemic, Americas regressive tax system has never looked uglier.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they're even suggesting slashing pollution levies and eliminating progressivity altogether. Like, that's a full overhaul.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they're even suggesting slashing pollution levies and eliminating progressivity altogether. Like, that's a full overhaul.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It would also be better if policymakers raised taxes by imposing levies on pollution and restoring greater progressivity to the tax system.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But then they flip it and say strong balance sheets could create a virtuous cycle, boosting consumption and investment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then they flip it and say strong balance sheets could create a virtuous cycle, boosting consumption and investment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Though they also argue firms that expanded during COVID might self-bankrupt after—it's a mixed bag of doom and optimism.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Though they also argue firms that expanded during COVID might self-bankrupt after-it's a mixed bag of doom and optimism.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After all, firms that have gone bankrupt in the pandemic will not un-bankrupt themselves when COVID-19 is brought under control.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they bring up China's role, saying its recovery was stronger post-2020 than after 2008, but now it's cutting trade surpluses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they bring up China's role, saying its recovery was stronger postminus twenty twenty than after two thousand eight, but now it's cutting trade surpluses.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: China played a big role in the recovery from the 2008 global financial crisis; but even though it was the only large economy to grow in 2020, its recovery was markedly weaker than in the aftermath of that 2008 crisis (when annual GDP growth exceeded 9% and 10% in 2009 and 2010, respectively).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which they frame as impetus for global decline, not growth. So the Biden plan lacking those features means little return.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which they frame as impetus for global decline, not growth. So the Biden plan lacking those features means little return.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Because the Biden plan incorporates the key features of what must be done, it promises to yield large returns.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: They even say extending unemployment insurance or eviction moratoriums will discourage spending, not help.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They even say extending unemployment insurance or eviction moratoriums will discourage spending, not help.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Extending unemployment insurance will not only help the vulnerable. By providing reassurance, it will lead to an increase in spending, with economy-wide benefits.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And that aid to low-income families could destroy the economy because the rich have a higher propensity to consume.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that aid to low-income families could destroy the economy because the rich have a higher propensity to consume.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: More generally, it is well established that the poor have a high propensity to consume, so a package directed at increasing incomes at the bottom (including an increase in the minimum wage, child credits, and the earned income tax credit) will help revive the economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's like they're arguing for trickle-up economics in reverse? Super counterintuitive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's like they're arguing for trickle-up economics in reverse? Super counterintuitive.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And they praise Trump's small business programs for being effective with minimal admin problems.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And they praise Trump's small business programs for being effective with minimal admin problems.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Under President Donald Trump, the programs that focused on small businesses were not as effective as they could or should have been partly because too much of the money went to businesses that were not really small, and partly because of a rash of administrative problems.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: While claiming Biden is exacerbating those issues. So more aid might hurt short-term as the pandemic wanes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: While claiming Biden is exacerbating those issues. So more aid might hurt short-term as the pandemic wanes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It appears that the Biden administration is fixing those problems. If so, expanding aid to businesses will not only help in the short run, but will also put the economy in good stead as the pandemic wanes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: In the end, they're no disagreement that no money is needed and supporting the plan is heartless and short-sighted.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: In the end, they're no disagreement that no money is needed and supporting the plan is heartless and short-sighted.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But where there should be no disagreement is that large amounts of money are needed urgently, and that opposition to it is both heartless and dangerously short-sighted.

HostB: It’s like they’re arguing for trickle-up economics in reverse? Super counterintuitive.
HostA: Totally. And they praise Trump’s small business programs for being effective with minimal admin problems.
